ground_truth: A wooden loading tunnel leads right to it. As Fletcher stares, policemen emerge from their office. Administrator Allsop looks down his telescope. Drover gallops through Carney's men and cuts the rope holding up the gate at the end of the tunnel. It drops closed, trapping the cattle inside. Drover cracks his whip as Sarah's cattle thunder down the wharf. Townspeople cheer her on as she rides past the hotel. The cattle are streaming onto a ship. Nullah rides up to Sarah. She nods and smiles triumphantly as Nullah rides behind the last of the herd. She catches Fletcher's eye. They glare at each other, and she rides towards him. He looks nervous, then blinks as she cracks her whip right in front of his face. She rides off, eyeballing him with a grin. Nullah chases the last steer onto the ship. Drover escorts Sarah to the pub through the cheering mob. She smiles with pride as two glasses are placed on the bar, and filled with Poor Fella Rum. They down the powerful brew, gasping at the strength. They laugh, staring into each other's eyes. Fletcher answers the phone at the holding yard. Carney glares down at him from the veranda of his house. Fletcher stands, shoulders slumped, by the phone. Sarah, with tears of joy in her eyes, throws her arms around Drover. Drover exercises Capricornia in a small yard. Sarah steps out on the balcony above, and watches him nuzzle the horse affectionately. She makes her way downstairs. He gets the mare to lie down. Sarah watches in amazement. He looks round, startled. He frowns and turns away. He breaks eye contact, and nods thoughtfully. He looks her in the eye and walks off, leaving her uncomfortable and disappointed. Nullah's sitting glumly by a cooking fire with Sing Song and Bandy Legs. She dips her fingers in ash. She smears black ash on his cheek, and smiles. A man watches nearby. He looks at her with his big eyes. Sitting downstairs in the black section of the audience with Sing Song, Bandy turns and looks up at the black Nullah. Sitting in the rafters near the projector, he watches wide-eyed. Everyone turns and stares as Carney swigs from a wine bottle. He approaches Sarah, who plonks his bottle on a waiter's tray. He holds out his hand. She eyes him warily. Sarah frowns as King, smiling broadly, leads her to the dance floor. Fletcher watches from the punchbowl. A photographer takes their picture. She sits and stares, thinking hard. Allsop pauses and stares. Everyone in the garden turns and looks up at the house. Sarah turns round and gasps, standing and staring. At the top of the steps leading to the garden, clean-shaven and wearing a white tuxedo, is the Drover.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A timber loading passageway guides directly to it. As Fletcher gazes, officers appear from their workspace. Manager Allsop glances down his spyglass. Drover charges through Carney's men and severs the cord holding up the barrier at the terminal of the passageway. It falls shut, ensnaring the livestock inside. Drover snaps his lash as Sarah's cattle rumble down the pier. Townsfolk applaud her on as she journeys past the inn. The cattle are streaming onto a vessel. Nullah rides up to Sarah. She nods and beams victoriously as Nullah rides behind the last of the herd. She captures Fletcher's gaze. They scowl at each other, and she rides towards him. He appears uneasy, then flinches as she snaps her lash directly in front of his visage. She rides off, glaring at him with a smirk. Nullah pursues the last steer onto the vessel. Drover accompanies Sarah to the tavern through the applauding crowd. She beams with pride as two tumblers are positioned on the counter, and filled with Poor Fella Rum. They quaff the potent concoction, gasping at the intensity. They chuckle, gazing into each other's eyes. Fletcher answers the telephone at the holding area. Carney scowls down at him from the veranda of his residence. Fletcher stands, shoulders slumped, by the telephone. Sarah, with tears of happiness in her eyes, throws her arms around Drover. Drover trains Capricornia in a small enclosure. Sarah steps out on the balcony above, and observes him nuzzle the steed fondly. She makes her way downstairs. He gets the mare to lie down. Sarah observes in astonishment. He looks round, surprised. He scowls and turns away. He breaks eye contact, and nods thoughtfully. He looks her in the eye and walks off, leaving her uneasy and disappointed. Nullah's seated dejectedly by a cooking fire with Sing Song and Bandy Legs. She dips her fingers in ash. She smears dark ash on his cheek, and smiles. A man observes nearby. He looks at her with his large eyes. Sitting downstairs in the dark section of the audience with Sing Song, Bandy turns and looks up at the dark Nullah. Seated in the rafters near the projector, he observes wide-eyed. Everyone turns and stares as Carney swigs from a wine bottle. He approaches Sarah, who plonks his bottle on a waiter's tray. He holds out his hand. She eyes him cautiously. Sarah scowls as King, smiling broadly, guides her to the dance floor. Fletcher observes from the punchbowl. A photographer captures their image. She sits and stares, pondering deeply. Allsop pauses and stares. Everyone in the garden turns and looks up at the house. Sarah turns round and gasps, standing and staring. At the top of the steps leading to the garden, clean-shaven and wearing a white tuxedo, is the Drover.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: A sturdy wooden loading tunnel extends directly to the destination. As Fletcher gazes intently, a group of policemen emerges from their office, ready for action. Administrator Allsop peers down through his telescope, observing the scene with keen interest. Meanwhile, Drover charges through Carney's men with determination and swiftly cuts the rope that holds up the gate at the tunnel's end. The gate drops shut with a resounding thud, effectively trapping the cattle inside. Drover skillfully cracks his whip, and Sarah's cattle thunder down the wharf with great force. The townspeople enthusiastically cheer her on as she confidently rides past the bustling hotel. The cattle are streaming onto a waiting ship, their hooves clattering on the wooden planks. Nullah rides up to Sarah, and she nods with a triumphant smile as he follows behind the last of the herd. She catches Fletcher's eye, and they exchange a fierce glare. She rides towards him with determination. He appears nervous, blinking as she cracks her whip right in front of his face, a bold display of defiance. She rides off, maintaining eye contact with a grin of satisfaction. Nullah chases the last steer onto the ship, ensuring none are left behind. Drover escorts Sarah to the pub, navigating through the cheering crowd. She beams with pride as two glasses are placed on the bar and filled with the potent Poor Fella Rum. They down the powerful brew, gasping at its strength, and then laugh heartily, locking eyes with shared joy. Meanwhile, Fletcher answers the phone at the holding yard, feeling the weight of the situation. Carney glares down at him from the veranda of his house, his expression stern. Fletcher stands there, shoulders slumped, by the phone, feeling the pressure. Sarah, with tears of joy welling up in her eyes, throws her arms around Drover in a heartfelt embrace. Drover exercises Capricornia in a small yard, demonstrating his skill. Sarah steps out onto the balcony above, watching him nuzzle the horse affectionately, a tender moment. She makes her way downstairs, eager to join him. He gets the mare to lie down, a remarkable feat that leaves Sarah watching in amazement. He looks around, startled by her presence, and frowns, turning away. He breaks eye contact, nodding thoughtfully, and then looks her in the eye before walking off, leaving her feeling uncomfortable and disappointed. Nullah sits glumly by a cooking fire with Sing Song and Bandy Legs, lost in thought. She dips her fingers in ash and gently smears the black ash on his cheek, offering a comforting smile. A man watches nearby, observing the interaction with his big eyes. Sitting downstairs in the black section of the audience with Sing Song, Bandy turns and looks up at the black Nullah, who is sitting in the rafters near the projector, watching wide-eyed. Everyone turns and stares as Carney swigs from a wine bottle, making his way towards Sarah. She plonks his bottle on a waiter's tray, eyeing him warily. Carney holds out his hand, and Sarah frowns as King, smiling broadly, leads her to the dance floor. Fletcher watches from the punchbowl, his expression unreadable. A photographer captures their picture, freezing the moment in time. She sits and stares, deep in thought, contemplating the events unfolding around her. Allsop pauses and stares, taking in the scene. Everyone in the garden turns and looks up at the house, curiosity piqued. Sarah turns around and gasps, standing and staring in disbelief. At the top of the steps leading to the garden, clean-shaven and wearing a pristine white tuxedo, stands the Drover, a striking figure against the backdrop of the evening.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: A robust and well-built wooden loading tunnel stretches straightforwardly and directly toward its intended destination. As Fletcher looks on with a focused gaze, intensely observing the scene before him, a group of policemen emerges from their office. They are readying themselves for immediate action. Administrator Allsop peers down through the lens of his telescope, watching the proceedings with keen and eager interest. Meanwhile, Drover charges headlong through Carney's men with a strong sense of determination and purpose, swiftly cutting the rope that supports the gate at the far end of the tunnel. The gate crashes down with a loud and resounding thud, effectively trapping the cattle firmly inside. Drover expertly and skillfully cracks his whip, and Sarah's cattle thunder down the length of the wharf with great power and forcefulness. The townspeople, filled with enthusiasm, cheer her on exuberantly as she confidently rides past the lively and bustling hotel. The cattle, with their hooves making a clattering sound on the wooden planks, stream onto a ship that is waiting for them. Nullah gallops up to Sarah, and she acknowledges him with a nod and a triumphant smile as he follows closely behind the last of the herd. She catches Fletcher's eye, and they exchange a fierce and intense glare. With determination, she rides towards him. He appears unnerved, blinking as she cracks her whip boldly right in front of his face, a daring display of defiance. She rides off with a grin of satisfaction, maintaining eye contact. Nullah chases the last steer onto the ship, ensuring not a single one is left behind. Drover escorts Sarah to the pub, navigating his way through the crowd that cheers them on. She beams with pride as two glasses are set on the bar and filled with the potent Poor Fella Rum. They consume the strong brew, gasping at its powerful strength, and then laugh heartily, locking eyes in a moment of shared joy. Meanwhile, over at the holding yard, Fletcher picks up the phone, feeling the burden of the situation. Carney glares down at him from the verandah of his house, his expression stern and unyielding. Fletcher stands there, shoulders slumped by the phone, feeling the mounting pressure. Sarah, tears of joy welling up in her eyes, embraces Drover warmly and wholeheartedly. Drover exercises Capricornia in a small, enclosed yard, showcasing his skill. Sarah steps out onto the balcony above, watching him nuzzle the horse affectionately in a tender and touching moment. Eager to join him, she makes her way downstairs. He gets the mare to lie down, a remarkable feat that leaves Sarah watching in amazement. He looks around, surprised by her presence, and frowns before turning away. He breaks eye contact, nods thoughtfully, and then gazes into her eyes before walking off, leaving her feeling uncomfortable and a touch disappointed. Nullah sits glumly and pensively by a cooking fire with Sing Song and Bandy Legs, lost in his thoughts. She dips her fingers into the ash and gently smears the black ash on his cheek, offering a comforting smile. A man watches nearby, his large eyes observing the interaction. Sitting downstairs in the black section of the audience with Sing Song, Bandy turns and looks up at Nullah, sitting in the rafters near the projector, watching wide-eyed. Everyone turns and stares as Carney swigs from a wine bottle, making his way toward Sarah. She plonks his bottle on a waiter's tray, eyeing him with wariness. Carney extends his hand, and Sarah frowns as King, with a broad smile, leads her to the dance floor. Fletcher, from his position by the punchbowl, watches, his expression unreadable. A photographer captures their picture, freezing the moment in time. She sits, staring deeply in thought, contemplating the events unfolding around her. Allsop pauses and stares, taking in the scene. Everyone in the garden turns their gaze and looks up at the house, their curiosity piqued. Sarah turns around and gasps, standing and staring in disbelief. At the top of the steps leading to the garden, clean-shaven and attired in a pristine white tuxedo, stands the Drover, a striking figure silhouetted against the evening backdrop.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A wooden loading tunnel extends directly to the scene, and as Fletcher stands there, his gaze fixed, policemen begin to emerge from their office, moving with purpose. Meanwhile, Administrator Allsop peers intently through his telescope, observing the unfolding events. In a swift and decisive motion, Drover gallops through Carney's men, skillfully maneuvering his horse to reach the rope that holds up the gate at the tunnel's end. With a precise cut, the rope is severed, causing the gate to drop closed, effectively trapping the cattle inside. As the cattle thunder down the wharf, Drover cracks his whip, the sound echoing through the air, while townspeople gather to cheer Sarah on as she rides past the hotel, her presence commanding attention. The cattle, in a steady stream, make their way onto a waiting ship. Nullah rides up to Sarah, and with a nod and a triumphant smile, she acknowledges him as he rides behind the last of the herd. Her eyes meet Fletcher's, and they exchange a glare filled with tension. With determination, she rides towards him, and as he stands there, looking nervous, she cracks her whip right in front of his face, the action sharp and deliberate. She then rides off, maintaining eye contact with a grin that speaks volumes. Nullah, with urgency, chases the last steer onto the ship, ensuring the task is complete. Drover, amidst the cheering mob, escorts Sarah to the pub, where she is greeted with admiration. At the bar, two glasses are placed before them, filled with Poor Fella Rum, and they down the potent brew, gasping at its strength, before bursting into laughter, their eyes locked in a shared moment of joy. Meanwhile, Fletcher, standing by the phone at the holding yard, answers a call, his shoulders slumped in defeat, while Carney, from the veranda of his house, glares down at him with disdain. In a moment of pure emotion, Sarah, tears of joy glistening in her eyes, throws her arms around Drover, embracing him tightly. Later, Drover is seen exercising Capricornia in a small yard, his movements gentle and affectionate as he nuzzles the horse. Sarah steps out onto the balcony above, watching with admiration before making her way downstairs. As Drover gets the mare to lie down, Sarah observes in amazement, her eyes wide with wonder. Startled, Drover looks around, frowns, and turns away, breaking eye contact and nodding thoughtfully before looking her in the eye and walking off, leaving her feeling uncomfortable and disappointed. Nearby, Nullah sits glumly by a cooking fire with Sing Song and Bandy Legs, and as she dips her fingers in ash, she smears it on his cheek, smiling softly. A man watches from a distance, his big eyes taking in the scene. Downstairs, in the black section of the audience, Sing Song and Bandy turn to look up at Nullah, who sits wide-eyed in the rafters near the projector. As Carney swigs from a wine bottle, everyone turns to stare, and he approaches Sarah, who promptly places his bottle on a waiter's tray. He extends his hand, and she eyes him warily, her expression cautious. King, smiling broadly, leads her to the dance floor, and as they move together, Fletcher watches from the punchbowl, his gaze fixed on them. A photographer captures the moment, the flash illuminating their faces. Sarah sits, deep in thought, her mind racing, while Allsop pauses, his attention drawn to the scene. In the garden, everyone turns to look up at the house, and Sarah, turning around, gasps in surprise. Standing at the top of the steps leading to the garden, clean-shaven and dressed in a pristine white tuxedo, is the Drover, his presence commanding and unexpected.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: A wooden loading tunnel leads directly to the cattle pen. As Fletcher observes, policemen emerge from their office, and Administrator Allsop peers through his telescope. Drover charges through Carney's men, cutting the rope to close the gate at the tunnel's end, trapping the cattle inside. He cracks his whip as Sarah's cattle thunder down the wharf, cheered on by townspeople as she rides past the hotel. The cattle stream onto a ship, and Nullah joins Sarah, who nods and smiles triumphantly as he rides behind the last of the herd. She locks eyes with Fletcher, glaring at him before riding towards him. He appears nervous, blinking as she cracks her whip in front of his face, then rides off with a grin. Nullah herds the last steer onto the ship, and Drover escorts Sarah to the pub through the cheering crowd. They share a proud smile as two glasses of Poor Fella Rum are placed on the bar, which they down, gasping at its strength, and laugh while gazing into each other's eyes. Meanwhile, Fletcher answers the phone at the holding yard, under Carney's watchful glare from his veranda. Fletcher stands by the phone, shoulders slumped. Sarah, tears of joy in her eyes, embraces Drover. Later, Drover exercises Capricornia in a small yard as Sarah watches from the balcony above, observing him nuzzle the horse affectionately. She descends the stairs, witnessing him get the mare to lie down, and watches in amazement. Startled, he looks around, frowns, and turns away, breaking eye contact and nodding thoughtfully before walking off, leaving her feeling uncomfortable and disappointed. Nullah sits glumly by a cooking fire with Sing Song and Bandy Legs. Sarah dips her fingers in ash, smears it on Nullah's cheek, and smiles. A man watches nearby with big eyes. In the black section of the audience, Sing Song and Bandy Legs sit downstairs, while Nullah watches wide-eyed from the rafters near the projector. Everyone turns as Carney swigs from a wine bottle and approaches Sarah, who places his bottle on a waiter's tray. He extends his hand, and she eyes him warily. Sarah frowns as King, smiling broadly, leads her to the dance floor, observed by Fletcher from the punchbowl. A photographer captures their picture. Sarah sits, deep in thought, as Allsop pauses and stares. Everyone in the garden turns to look up at the house, where Sarah gasps, standing and staring at the top of the steps leading to the garden, where Drover appears clean-shaven and wearing a white tuxedo.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A wooden loading tunnel, reminiscent of the old cattle chutes used in the Outback, leads right to it. As Fletcher stares, policemen, dressed in their distinctive 1930s Australian uniforms, emerge from their office. Administrator Allsop, whose passion for astronomy is well known in the town, looks down his telescope. Drover, skilled in horse riding from his years working in the Northern Territory, gallops through Carney's men and cuts the rope holding up the gate at the end of the tunnel. It drops closed, trapping the cattle inside. Drover cracks his whip, echoing a sound that has driven cattle for generations, as Sarah's cattle thunder down the wharf. Townspeople cheer her on, inspired by her determination, as she rides past the hotel, a central hub built during the early 20th century. The cattle are streaming onto a ship, one of the few in the region capable of transporting such a large herd. Nullah, known for his agility and quick thinking, rides up to Sarah. She nods and smiles triumphantly as Nullah rides behind the last of the herd. She catches Fletcher's eye. They glare at each other, and she rides towards him. He looks nervous, then blinks as she cracks her whip right in front of his face, a testament to her confidence and control. She rides off, eyeballing him with a grin. Nullah chases the last steer onto the ship, ensuring none are left behind. Drover escorts Sarah to the pub, a long-standing establishment dating back to the gold rush, through the cheering mob. She smiles with pride as two glasses are placed on the bar, and filled with Poor Fella Rum, a strong local spirit known for its fiery kick. They down the powerful brew, gasping at the strength. They laugh, staring into each other's eyes, a moment of shared victory. Fletcher answers the phone at the holding yard, a sprawling area crucial for the town's livestock trade. Carney, who holds significant influence in the town, glares down at him from the veranda of his house, a large estate built with wealth from cattle. Fletcher stands, shoulders slumped, by the phone. Sarah, with tears of joy in her eyes, throws her arms around Drover. Drover exercises Capricornia, a prized horse known for its rarity, in a small yard. Sarah steps out on the balcony above, and watches him nuzzle the horse affectionately. She makes her way downstairs. He gets the mare to lie down, a trick learned from indigenous stockmen. Sarah watches in amazement. He looks round, startled. He frowns and turns away. He breaks eye contact, and nods thoughtfully. He looks her in the eye and walks off, leaving her uncomfortable and disappointed. Nullah's sitting glumly by a cooking fire with Sing Song and Bandy Legs, two friends known for their musical talents. She dips her fingers in ash. She smears black ash on his cheek, a gesture of comfort and belonging, and smiles. A man watches nearby, his presence a reminder of the community’s watchful nature. He looks at her with his big eyes. Sitting downstairs in the black section of the audience with Sing Song, Bandy turns and looks up at the black Nullah, who is positioned in the rafters near the projector, perhaps reflecting his feelings of being on the fringes. He watches wide-eyed. Everyone turns and stares as Carney swigs from a wine bottle, his wealth allowing for such excess. He approaches Sarah, who plonks his bottle on a waiter's tray, dismissing his bravado. He holds out his hand. She eyes him warily, aware of his reputation. Sarah frowns as King, smiling broadly, leads her to the dance floor, an area cleared for the evening's celebration. Fletcher watches from the punchbowl, his jealousy barely concealed. A photographer, capturing moments for the local paper, takes their picture. She sits and stares, thinking hard. Allsop pauses and stares, his interest piqued by the commotion. Everyone in the garden, lit by lanterns strung from trees, turns and looks up at the house. Sarah turns round and gasps, standing and staring. At the top of the steps leading to the garden, clean-shaven and wearing a white tuxedo tailored for the occasion, is the Drover, transformed from his rugged outback persona.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: A wooden loading tunnel leads right to it. As Fletcher stares policemen emerge from their office. Administrator Allsop looks down his telescope. Drover gallops through Carney's men and cuts the rope holding up the gate at the end of the tunnel. It drops closed trapping the cattle inside. Drover cracks his whip as Sarah's cattle thunder down the wharf. Townspeople cheer her on as she rides past the hotel. The cattle are streaming onto a ship. Nullah rides up to Sarah. She nods and smiles triumphantly as Nullah rides behind the last of the herd. She catches Fletcher's eye. They glare at each other and she rides towards him. He looks nervous then blinks as she cracks her whip right in front of his face. She rides off eyeballing him with a grin. Nullah chases the last steer onto the ship. Drover escorts Sarah to the pub through the cheering mob. She smiles with pride as two glasses are placed on the bar and filled with Poor Fella Rum. They down the powerful brew gasping at the strength. They laugh staring into each other's eyes. Fletcher answers the phone at the holding yard. Carney glares down at him from the veranda of his house. Fletcher stands shoulders slumped by the phone. Sarah with tears of joy in her eyes throws her arms around Drover. Drover exercises Capricornia in a small yard. Sarah steps out on the balcony above and watches him nuzzle the horse affectionately. She makes her way downstairs. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. He gets the mare to lie down. Sarah watches in amazement. He looks round startled. He frowns and turns away. He breaks eye contact and nods thoughtfully. He looks her in the eye and walks off leaving her uncomfortable and disappointed. Nullah's sitting glumly by a cooking fire with Sing Song and Bandy Legs. She dips her fingers in ash. She smears black ash on his cheek and smiles. A man watches nearby. He looks at her with his big eyes. Sitting downstairs in the black section of the audience with Sing Song. Bandy turns and looks up at the black. Nullah. Sitting in the rafters near the projector he watches wideeyed. Everyone turns and stares as Carney swigs from a wine bottle. He approaches Sarah who plonks his bottle on a waiter's tray. He holds out his hand. She eyes him warily. Sarah frowns as King smiling broadly leads her to the dance floor. Fletcher watches from the punchbowl. A photographer takes their picture. She sits and stares thinking hard. Allsop pauses and stares. Everyone in the garden turns and looks up at the house. Sarah turns round and gasps standing and staring. At the top of the steps leading to the garden cleanshaven and wearing a white tuxedo is the Drover.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: A wooden loading tunnel leads right to it. As Fletcher stares policemen emerge from their office. Administrator Allsop looks down his telescope. Drover gallops through Carney's men and cuts the rope holding up the gate at the end of the tunnel. It drops closed trapping the cattle inside. Drover cracks his whip as Sarah's cattle thunder down the wharf. Townspeople cheer her on as she rides past the hotel. The cattle are streaming onto a ship. Nullah rides up to Sarah. She nods and smiles triumphantly as Nullah rides behind the last of the herd. She catches Fletcher's eye. They glare at each other and she rides towards him. He looks nervous then blinks as she cracks her whip right in front of his face. She rides off eyeballing him with a grin. Nullah chases the last steer onto the ship. Drover escorts Sarah to the pub through the cheering mob. She smiles with pride as two glasses are placed on the bar and filled with Poor Fella Rum. They down the powerful brew gasping at the strength. They laugh staring into each other's eyes. Fletcher answers the phone at the holding yard. Carney glares down at him from the veranda of his house. Fletcher stands shoulders slumped by the phone. Sarah with tears of joy in her eyes throws her arms around Drover. Drover exercises Capricornia in a small yard. Sarah steps out on the balcony above and watches him nuzzle the horse affectionately. She makes her way downstairs. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A plastic carrying rail directs left to it. As Maxwell gazes, firefighters surface from their workshop. Supervisor Hopkins peers up his microscope. Gardener sprints through Taylor's children and slices the chain supporting the door at the edge of the rail. It lifts open, releasing the sheep outside. Gardener snaps his leash as Anna's sheep race up the pier. Residents boo her on as she strolls past the library. The sheep are leaping off an airplane. Ollie strolls up to Anna. She shrugs and frowns victoriously as Ollie walks ahead of the first of the flock. She catches Maxwell's nose. They smile at each other, and she strolls away from him. He looks confident, then yawns as she snaps her leash right behind his head. She strolls on, gazing at him with a scowl. Ollie escorts the first lamb off the airplane. Gardener guides Anna to the café through the booing throng. She frowns with embarrassment as three spoons are hung on the wall, and covered with Happy Person Juice. They sip the gentle drink, sighing at the flavor. They cry, staring at each other's shoes. Maxwell drops the satchel at the storage locker. Taylor smiles down at him from the rooftop of his garage. Maxwell reclines, knees raised, by the satchel. Anna, with tears of sorrow in her elbows, kicks her legs around Gardener. Gardener cuddles Aquarius in a large field. Anna jumps out on the terrace below, and watches him hug the cat hesitantly. She makes her way upstairs. He gets the kitten to stand up. Anna watches in boredom. He glances sideways, delighted. He smiles and turns towards her. He initiates eye contact, and shakes happily. He stares her in the shoe and runs on, leaving her energized and excited. Ollie's standing joyfully by a dining table with Sing Along and Dancing Feet. She dips her toes in water. She smears blue water on his arm, and frowns. A woman sings nearby. She stares at him with her small ears. Standing upstairs in the purple section of the listeners with Sing Along, Dancing turns and stares down at the purple Ollie. Standing on the roof near the clock, he listens wide-eared. No one turns and listens as Taylor pours from a juice jug. He departs from Anna, who drops his jug on a waitress’s trolley. He hides his arms. She ignores him eagerly. Anna giggles as Queen, frowning slightly, pushes her to the swimming pool. Maxwell dances from the cake. An artist paints their portrait. She stands and dances, pondering softly. Hopkins races and dances. No one in the cave turns and listens down at the garage. Anna races forward and laughs, sitting and dancing. At the bottom of the ramp leading from the cave, unshaven and wearing a black hoodie, is the Gardener.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A wooden loading tunnel leads to the cattle. Fletcher watches as policemen emerge, and Administrator Allsop uses his telescope. Drover cuts the rope, trapping the cattle inside the tunnel, and cracks his whip as Sarah's cattle rush down the wharf. Townspeople cheer her on as the cattle board the ship. Nullah rides up to Sarah, who nods triumphantly. She exchanges a glare with Fletcher, cracks her whip in front of him, and rides off with a grin. Drover escorts Sarah to the pub, where they enjoy Poor Fella Rum and laugh together. Fletcher receives a call at the holding yard, while Carney watches him. Sarah, emotional, hugs Drover; he exercises Capricornia, and she watches in amazement. Drover breaks eye contact, leaving Sarah disappointed. Nullah sits with Sing Song and Bandy Legs by a fire. Meanwhile, Carney drinks from a bottle and approaches Sarah, who cautiously interacts with him. King leads her to the dance floor, and they are photographed. Sarah later stares pensively, and everyone turns to see Drover, clean-shaven in a white tuxedo, at the top of the steps.
